newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures end lower, following Chicago.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures end lower, following Chicago.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures settled lower across the board on Tuesday, following the weaker Chicago market on Monday, traders said.
Prices ranged from 250 yen to 320 yen weaker, with benchmark November down 260 yen at 14,440 yen per tonne. Daily volume was 73,041 lots.

Bearish sentiment dominated the Tokyo corn futures market, sending the July contract down by its daily limit of 500 yen per tonne in the early afternoon session. "Continued dips in the Chicago market, along with bearish technical factors here, prompted investors to liquidate their longs," one trader said.
The spot December contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was being traded at $2.79 per bushel at 0910 GMT, unchanged from Monday.
The spot November CBOT soybean futures contract was at $6.80-1/2 at 0910 GMT, down by 1.00-1/2 cents from Monday.
